text: commissioner of taxation v hart  income tax
tax benefit under income tax assessment act 1936 (cth)
whether scheme entered into for the dominant purpose of obtaining a tax benefit
where money borrowed in part to purchase a principal place of residence and in part to refinance investment property used to produce assessable income
where expenditure in relation to producing assessable income deductible
where repayments on loan applied solely in satisfaction of that part of the loan not used to produce assessable income.
identification of the scheme to which part iva of the income tax assessment act 1936 (cth) applied
whether the primary judge focussed on a tax benefit different to the tax benefit the subject of the commissioner's part iva determination
whether the scheme was entered into or carried out for the dominant purpose of obtaining a tax benefit in connection with the scheme
